body_html:
I checked it in new virtualenv and results as follow:

  • Installing from the built source by me >> got the same error (in the other virtualenv I'm also using my own build)
  • Installing from wheel works fine

I build from the source touching nothing, just git pull and following the instruction on the website.

btw, the reason I built it from source was that the freeze_graph() python code doesn't run because of lacking graph_util.convert_variables_to_constants() method was not in the wheel but in the git. I think you should update the wheel with new build.
body_text:
I checked it in new virtualenv and results as follow:

Installing from the built source by me >> got the same error (in the other virtualenv I'm also using my own build)
Installing from wheel works fine

I build from the source touching nothing, just git pull and following the instruction on the website.
btw, the reason I built it from source was that the freeze_graph() python code doesn't run because of lacking graph_util.convert_variables_to_constants() method was not in the wheel but in the git. I think you should update the wheel with new build.
body:
I checked it in new virtualenv and results as follow:
- Installing from the built source by me >> got the same error (in the other virtualenv I'm also using my own build)
- Installing from wheel works fine

I build from the source touching nothing, just git pull and following the instruction on the website.

btw, the reason I built it from source was that the `freeze_graph()` python code doesn't run because of lacking `graph_util.convert_variables_to_constants()` method was not in the wheel but in the git. I think you should update the wheel with new build.
